Sentencas: The choice of suitable electrodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs) represents a challenge toward full commercialization.
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Conventional materials used for high-temperature SOFCs, such as Ni-containing anodic cermets (Ni-YSZ) and Co-based perovskite cathodes (La0.6Sr0.4Fe0.8Co0.2O3-delta, LSCF, Ba0.6Sr0.4Fe0.8Co0.2O3-delta, BSCF), suffer from compatibility issues if coupled with a highly performing La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-delta (LSGM) electrolyte.
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Thus, perovskite-type mixed conductors have been extensively studied as potential electrodes for all-perovskite devices.
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: In the present study, the effect of controlled noble metal doping at the B-site of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-delta (LSF) is investigated.
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: The introduction of 1 mol % ruthenium or platinum is successfully achieved: La0.6Sr0.4Fe0.99Ru0.01O3-delta (LSFR) and La0.6Sr0.4Fe0.99Pt0.01O3-delta (LSFP) single-phase compounds are obtained.
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: The structural, morphological, electrical, and electrochemical characterizations of LSFR and LSFP are provided and discussed.
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Both platinum and ruthenium doping reveal to be effective in improving the electrocatalytic properties of the parent perovskite structure:
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Pt increases the number of oxygen vacancies, thus promoting the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) and reducing the LSF polarization resistance by 12.9%, while Ru improves LSF stability in reducing conditions promoting the exsolution of metal nanoparticles.
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: All-perovskite cells LSFR/LSGM/LSFP are fabricated and tested in H-2, showing remarkable performances in the intermediate-temperature range.
Titulo: Enhancing Oxygen Reduction Activity and Structural Stability of La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ by 1 mol % Pt and Ru B-Site Doping for Application in All-Perovskite IT-SOFCs
